1013  //============================================================================
1014  // Method Description:
1026  template<typename dtype>
1027  bool allclose(const NdArray<dtype>& inArray1, const NdArray<dtype>& inArray2, double inTolerance)
1028  {
1029  if (inArray1.shape() != inArray2.shape())
1030  {
1031  std::string errStr = "ERROR: allclose: input array dimensions are not consistant.";
1032  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
1033  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
1034  }
1035 
1036  for (uint32 i = 0; i < inArray1.size(); ++i)
1037  {
1038  if (std::abs(inArray1[i] - inArray2[i]) > inTolerance)
1039  {
1040  return false;
1041  }
1042  }
1043 
1044  return true;
1045  }

1114  //============================================================================
1115  // Method Description:
1128  template<typename dtype>
1129  NdArray<dtype> append(const NdArray<dtype>& inArray, const NdArray<dtype>& inAppendValues, Axis inAxis)
1130  {
1131  switch (inAxis)
1132  {
1133  case Axis::NONE:
1134  {
1135  NdArray<dtype> returnArray(1, inArray.size() + inAppendValues.size());
1136  std::copy(inArray.cbegin(), inArray.cend(), returnArray.begin());
1137  std::copy(inAppendValues.cbegin(), inAppendValues.cend(), returnArray.begin() + inArray.size());
1138 
1139  return std::move(returnArray);
1140  }
1141  case Axis::ROW:
1142  {
1143  Shape inShape = inArray.shape();
1144  Shape appendShape = inAppendValues.shape();
1145  if (inShape.cols != appendShape.cols)
1146  {
1147  std::string errStr = "ERROR: append: all the input array dimensions except for the concatenation axis must match exactly";
1148  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
1149  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
1150  }
1151 
1152  NdArray<dtype> returnArray(inShape.rows + appendShape.rows, inShape.cols);
1153  std::copy(inArray.cbegin(), inArray.cend(), returnArray.begin());
1154  std::copy(inAppendValues.cbegin(), inAppendValues.cend(), returnArray.begin() + inArray.size());
1155 
1156  return std::move(returnArray);
1157  }
1158  case Axis::COL:
1159  {
1160  Shape inShape = inArray.shape();
1161  Shape appendShape = inAppendValues.shape();
1162  if (inShape.rows != appendShape.rows)
1163  {
1164  std::string errStr = "ERROR: append: all the input array dimensions except for the concatenation axis must match exactly";
1165  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
1166  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
1167  }
1168 
1169  NdArray<dtype> returnArray(inShape.rows, inShape.cols + appendShape.cols);
1170  for (uint32 row = 0; row < returnArray.shape().rows; ++row)
1171  {
1172  std::copy(inArray.cbegin(row), inArray.cend(row), returnArray.begin(row));
1173  std::copy(inAppendValues.cbegin(row), inAppendValues.cend(row), returnArray.begin(row) + inShape.cols);
1174  }
1175 
1176  return std::move(returnArray);
1177  }
1178  default:
1179  {
1180  // this isn't actually possible, just putting this here to get rid
1181  // of the compiler warning.
1182  return std::move(NdArray<dtype>(0));
1183  }
1184  }
1185  }
1186 
1187  //============================================================================
1188  // Method Description:
1207  template<typename dtype>
1208  NdArray<dtype> arange(dtype inStart, dtype inStop, dtype inStep)
1209  {
1210  if (inStep > 0 && inStop < inStart)
1211  {
1212  std::string errStr = "ERROR: arange: stop value must be larger than the start value for positive step.";
1213  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
1214  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
1215  }
1216 
1217  if (inStep < 0 && inStop > inStart)
1218  {
1219  std::string errStr = "ERROR: arange: start value must be larger than the stop value for negative step.";
1220  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
1221  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
1222  }
1223 
1224  std::vector<dtype> values;
1225 
1226  dtype theValue = inStart;
1227 
1228  if (inStep > 0)
1229  {
1230  while (theValue < inStop)
1231  {
1232  values.push_back(theValue);
1233  theValue += static_cast<dtype>(inStep);
1234  }
1235  }
1236  else
1237  {
1238  while (theValue > inStop)
1239  {
1240  values.push_back(theValue);
1241  theValue += static_cast<dtype>(inStep);
1242  }
1243  }
1244 
1245  return std::move(NdArray<dtype>(values));
1246  }
1247 
1248  //============================================================================
1249  // Method Description:
1267  template<typename dtype>
1268  NdArray<dtype> arange(dtype inStop)
1269  {
1270  if (inStop <= 0)
1271  {
1272  std::string errStr = "ERROR: arange: stop value must ge greater than 0.";
1273  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
1274  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
1275  }
1276 
1277  return std::move(arange<dtype>(0, inStop, 1));
1278  }

1482  //============================================================================
1483  // Method Description:
1493  template<typename dtype>
1494  NdArray<double> arctan2(const NdArray<dtype>& inY, const NdArray<dtype>& inX)
1495  {
1496  if (inX.shape() != inY.shape())
1497  {
1498  std::string errStr = "Error: arctan2: input array shapes are not consistant.";
1499  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
1500  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
1501  }
1502 
1503  NdArray<double> returnArray(inY.shape());

1506

1774  //============================================================================
1775  // Method Description:
1786  template<typename dtype>
1787  NdArray<double> average(const NdArray<dtype>& inArray, const NdArray<dtype>& inWeights, Axis inAxis)
1788  {
1789  switch (inAxis)
1790  {
1791  case Axis::NONE:
1792  {
1793  if (inWeights.shape() != inArray.shape())
1794  {
1795  std::string errStr = "ERROR: average: input array and weight values are not consistant.";
1796  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
1797  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
1798  }
1799 
1800  NdArray<double> weightedArray(inArray.shape());
1801  std::transform(inArray.cbegin(), inArray.cend(), inWeights.cbegin(), weightedArray.begin(), std::multiplies<double>());
1802 
1803  double sum = static_cast<double>(std::accumulate(weightedArray.begin(), weightedArray.end(), 0.0));
1804  NdArray<double> returnArray = { sum /= inWeights.template sum<double>().item() };
1805 
1806  return std::move(returnArray);
1807  }
1808  case Axis::COL:
1809  {
1810  Shape arrayShape = inArray.shape();
1811  if (inWeights.size() != arrayShape.cols)
1812  {
1813  std::string errStr = "ERROR: average: input array and weights value are not consistant.";
1814  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
1815  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
1816  }
1817 
1818  double weightSum = inWeights.template sum<double>().item();
1819  NdArray<double> returnArray(1, arrayShape.rows);
1820  for (uint32 row = 0; row < arrayShape.rows; ++row)
1821  {
1822  NdArray<double> weightedArray(1, arrayShape.cols);
1823  std::transform(inArray.cbegin(row), inArray.cend(row), inWeights.cbegin(), weightedArray.begin(), std::multiplies<double>());
1824 
1825  double sum = static_cast<double>(std::accumulate(weightedArray.begin(), weightedArray.end(), 0.0));
1826  returnArray(0, row) = sum / weightSum;
1827  }
1828 
1829  return std::move(returnArray);
1830  }
1831  case Axis::ROW:
1832  {
1833  if (inWeights.size() != inArray.shape().rows)
1834  {
1835  std::string errStr = "ERROR: average: input array and weight values are not consistant.";
1836  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
1837  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
1838  }
1839 
1840  NdArray<dtype> transposedArray = inArray.transpose();
1841 
1842  Shape transShape = transposedArray.shape();
1843  double weightSum = inWeights.template sum<double>().item();
1844  NdArray<double> returnArray(1, transShape.rows);
1845  for (uint32 row = 0; row < transShape.rows; ++row)
1846  {
1847  NdArray<double> weightedArray(1, transShape.cols);
1848  std::transform(transposedArray.cbegin(row), transposedArray.cend(row), inWeights.cbegin(), weightedArray.begin(), std::multiplies<double>());
1849 
1850  double sum = static_cast<double>(std::accumulate(weightedArray.begin(), weightedArray.end(), 0.0));
1851  returnArray(0, row) = sum / weightSum;
1852  }
1853 
1854  return std::move(returnArray);
1855  }
1856  default:
1857  {
1858  // this isn't actually possible, just putting this here to get rid
1859  // of the compiler warning.
1860  return std::move(NdArray<double>(0));
1861  }
1862  }
1863  }

1881  //============================================================================
1882  // Method Description:
1899  template<typename dtype>
1900  NdArray<dtype> bincount(const NdArray<dtype>& inArray, uint16 inMinLength)
1901  {
1902  // only works with integer input types
1903  static_assert(DtypeInfo<dtype>::isInteger(), "ERROR: bincount: can only use with integer types.");
1904 
1905  dtype maxValue = inArray.max().item();
1906  if (maxValue < 0)
1907  {
1908  // no positive values so just return an empty array
1909  return std::move(NdArray<dtype>(0));
1910  }
1911 
1912  if (maxValue + 1 > DtypeInfo<dtype>::max())
1913  {
1914  std::string errStr = "Error: bincount: array values too large, will result in gigantic array that will take up alot of memory...";
1915  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
1916  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
1917  }
1918 
1919  uint16 outArraySize = std::max(static_cast<uint16>(maxValue + 1), inMinLength);
1920  NdArray<dtype> clippedArray = inArray.clip(0, maxValue);
1921 
1922  NdArray<dtype> outArray(1, outArraySize);
1923  outArray.zeros();
1924  for (uint32 i = 0; i < inArray.size(); ++i)
1925  {
1926  ++outArray[clippedArray[i]];
1927  }
1928 
1929  return std::move(outArray);
1930  }
1931 
1932  //============================================================================
1933  // Method Description:
1953  template<typename dtype>
1954  NdArray<dtype> bincount(const NdArray<dtype>& inArray, const NdArray<dtype>& inWeights, uint16 inMinLength)
1955  {
1956  // only works with integer input types
1957  static_assert(DtypeInfo<dtype>::isInteger(), "ERROR: bincount: can only use with integer types.");
1958 
1959  if (inArray.shape() != inWeights.shape())
1960  {
1961  std::string errStr = "ERROR: bincount: weights array must be the same shape as the input array.";
1962  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
1963  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
1964  }
1965 
1966  dtype maxValue = inArray.max().item();
1967  if (maxValue < 0)
1968  {
1969  // no positive values so just return an empty array
1970  return std::move(NdArray<dtype>(0));
1971  }
1972 
1973  if (maxValue + 1 > DtypeInfo<dtype>::max())
1974  {
1975  std::string errStr = "Error: bincount: array values too large, will result in gigantic array that will take up alot of memory...";
1976  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
1977  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
1978  }
1979 
1980  uint16 outArraySize = std::max(static_cast<uint16>(maxValue + 1), inMinLength);
1981  NdArray<dtype> clippedArray = inArray.clip(0, maxValue);
1982 
1983  NdArray<dtype> outArray(1, outArraySize);
1984  outArray.zeros();
1985  for (uint32 i = 0; i < inArray.size(); ++i)
1986  {
1987  outArray[clippedArray[i]] += inWeights[i];
1988  }
1989 
1990  return std::move(outArray);
1991  }

2184  //============================================================================
2185  // Method Description:
2195  template<typename dtype>
2196  NdArray<dtype> column_stack(const std::initializer_list<NdArray<dtype> >& inArrayList)
2197  {
2198  // first loop through to calculate the final size of the array
2199  typename std::initializer_list<NdArray<dtype> >::iterator iter;
2200  Shape finalShape;
2201  for (iter = inArrayList.begin(); iter < inArrayList.end(); ++iter)
2202  {
2203  if (finalShape.isnull())
2204  {
2205  finalShape = iter->shape();
2206  }
2207  else if (iter->shape().rows != finalShape.rows)
2208  {
2209  std::string errStr = "ERROR: column_stack: input arrays must have the same number of rows.";
2210  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
2211  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
2212  }
2213  else
2214  {
2215  finalShape.cols += iter->shape().cols;
2216  }
2217  }
2218 
2219  // now that we know the final size, contruct the output array
2220  NdArray<dtype> returnArray(finalShape);
2221  uint32 colStart = 0;
2222  for (iter = inArrayList.begin(); iter < inArrayList.end(); ++iter)
2223  {
2224  Shape theShape = iter->shape();
2225  for (uint32 row = 0; row < theShape.rows; ++row)
2226  {
2227  for (uint32 col = 0; col < theShape.cols; ++col)
2228  {
2229  returnArray(row, colStart + col) = iter->operator()(row, col);
2230  }
2231  }
2232  colStart += theShape.cols;
2233  }
2234 
2235  return std::move(returnArray);
2236  }
2237 
2238  //============================================================================
2239  // Method Description:
2249  template<typename dtype>
2250  NdArray<dtype> concatenate(const std::initializer_list<NdArray<dtype> >& inArrayList, Axis inAxis)
2251  {
2252  switch (inAxis)
2253  {
2254  case Axis::NONE:
2255  {
2256  uint32 finalSize = 0;
2257  typename std::initializer_list<NdArray<dtype> >::iterator iter;
2258  for (iter = inArrayList.begin(); iter < inArrayList.end(); ++iter)
2259  {
2260  finalSize += iter->size();
2261  }
2262 
2263  NdArray<dtype> returnArray(1, finalSize);
2264  uint32 offset = 0;
2265  for (iter = inArrayList.begin(); iter < inArrayList.end(); ++iter)
2266  {
2267  std::copy(iter->cbegin(), iter->cend(), returnArray.begin() + offset);
2268  offset += iter->size();
2269  }
2270 
2271  return std::move(returnArray);
2272  }
2273  case Axis::ROW:
2274  {
2275  return std::move(row_stack(inArrayList));
2276  }
2277  case Axis::COL:
2278  {
2279  return std::move(column_stack(inArrayList));
2280  }
2281  default:
2282  {
2283  // this isn't actually possible, just putting this here to get rid
2284  // of the compiler warning.
2285  return std::move(NdArray<dtype>(0));
2286  }
2287  }
2288  }

2454  template<typename dtype>
2455  NdArray<uint32> count_nonzero(const NdArray<dtype>& inArray, Axis inAxis)
2456  {
2457  switch (inAxis)
2458  {
2459  case Axis::NONE:
2460  {
2461  NdArray<uint32> count = { inArray.nonzero().size() };
2462  return count;
2463  }
2464  case Axis::COL:
2465  {
2466  Shape inShape = inArray.shape();

2475  {
2476  ++returnArray(0, row);
2477  }
2478  }
2479  }
2480 
2481  return std::move(returnArray);
2482  }
2483  case Axis::ROW:
2484  {
2485  Shape inShape = inArray.shape();
2486 
2487  NdArray<uint32> returnArray(1, inShape.cols);
2488  returnArray.zeros();
2489  for (uint32 col = 0; col < inShape.cols; ++col)
2490  {
2491  for (uint32 row = 0; row < inShape.rows; ++row)
2492  {
2493  if (inArray(row, col) != static_cast<dtype>(0))
2494  {
2495  ++returnArray(0, col);
2496  }
2497  }
2498  }
2499 
2500  return std::move(returnArray);
2501  }
2502  default:
2503  {
2504  // this isn't actually possible, just putting this here to get rid
2505  // of the compiler warning.
2506  return std::move(NdArray<uint32>(0));
2507  }
2508  }
2509  }

2511  //============================================================================
2512  // Method Description:
2523  template<typename dtypeOut = double, typename dtype>
2524  NdArray<dtypeOut> cross(const NdArray<dtype>& inArray1, const NdArray<dtype>& inArray2, Axis inAxis)
2525  {
2526  if (inArray1.shape() != inArray2.shape())
2527  {
2528  std::string errStr = "ERROR: cross: the input array dimensions are not consistant.";
2529  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
2530  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
2531  }
2532 
2533  switch (inAxis)
2534  {
2535  case Axis::NONE:
2536  {
2537  uint32 arraySize = inArray1.size();
2538  if (arraySize != inArray2.size() || arraySize < 2 || arraySize > 3)
2539  {
2540  std::string errStr = "ERROR: cross: incompatible dimensions for cross product (dimension must be 2 or 3)";
2541  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
2542  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
2543  }
2544 
2545  NdArray<dtype> in1 = inArray1.flatten();
2546  NdArray<dtype> in2 = inArray2.flatten();
2547 
2548  switch (arraySize)
2549  {
2550  case 2:
2551  {
2552  NdArray<dtypeOut> returnArray = { static_cast<dtypeOut>(in1[0]) * static_cast<dtypeOut>(in2[1])
2553  - static_cast<dtypeOut>(in1[1]) * static_cast<dtypeOut>(in2[0]) };
2554  return std::move(returnArray);
2555  }
2556  case 3:
2557  {
2558  dtypeOut i = static_cast<dtypeOut>(in1[1]) * static_cast<dtypeOut>(in2[2])
2559  - static_cast<dtypeOut>(in1[2]) * static_cast<dtypeOut>(in2[1]);
2560  dtypeOut j = -(static_cast<dtypeOut>(in1[0]) * static_cast<dtypeOut>(in2[2])
2561  - static_cast<dtypeOut>(in1[2]) * static_cast<dtypeOut>(in2[0]));
2562  dtypeOut k = (static_cast<dtypeOut>(in1[0]) * static_cast<dtypeOut>(in2[1])
2563  - static_cast<dtypeOut>(in1[1]) * static_cast<dtypeOut>(in2[0]));
2564 
2565  NdArray<dtypeOut> returnArray = { i, j, k };
2566  return std::move(returnArray);
2567  }
2568  default:
2569  {
2570  // this isn't actually possible, just putting this here to get rid
2571  // of the compiler warning.
2572  return std::move(NdArray<dtypeOut>(0));
2573  }
2574  }
2575  }
2576  case Axis::ROW:
2577  {
2578  Shape arrayShape = inArray1.shape();
2579  if (arrayShape != inArray2.shape() || arrayShape.rows < 2 || arrayShape.rows > 3)
2580  {
2581  std::string errStr = "ERROR: cross: incompatible dimensions for cross product (dimension must be 2 or 3)";
2582  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
2583  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
2584  }
2585 
2586  Shape returnArrayShape;
2587  if (arrayShape.rows == 2)
2588  {
2589  returnArrayShape = Shape(1, arrayShape.cols);
2590  }
2591  else
2592  {
2593  returnArrayShape = Shape(3, arrayShape.cols);
2594  }
2595 
2596  NdArray<dtypeOut> returnArray(returnArrayShape);
2597  for (uint32 col = 0; col < arrayShape.cols; ++col)
2598  {
2599  int32 theCol = static_cast<int32>(col);
2600  NdArray<dtype> vec1 = inArray1({ 0, static_cast<int32>(arrayShape.rows) }, { theCol, theCol + 1 });
2601  NdArray<dtype> vec2 = inArray2({ 0, static_cast<int32>(arrayShape.rows) }, { theCol, theCol + 1 });
2602  NdArray<dtypeOut> vecCross = cross<dtypeOut>(vec1, vec2, Axis::NONE);
2603 
2604  returnArray.put({ 0, static_cast<int32>(returnArrayShape.rows) }, { theCol, theCol + 1 }, vecCross);
2605  }
2606 
2607  return std::move(returnArray);
2608  }
2609  case Axis::COL:
2610  {
2611  Shape arrayShape = inArray1.shape();
2612  if (arrayShape != inArray2.shape() || arrayShape.cols < 2 || arrayShape.cols > 3)
2613  {
2614  std::string errStr = "ERROR: cross: incompatible dimensions for cross product (dimension must be 2 or 3)";
2615  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
2616  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
2617  }
2618 
2619  Shape returnArrayShape;
2620  if (arrayShape.cols == 2)
2621  {
2622  returnArrayShape = Shape(arrayShape.rows, 1);
2623  }
2624  else
2625  {
2626  returnArrayShape = Shape(arrayShape.rows, 3);
2627  }
2628 
2629  NdArray<dtypeOut> returnArray(returnArrayShape);
2630  for (uint32 row = 0; row < arrayShape.rows; ++row)
2631  {
2632  int32 theRow = static_cast<int32>(row);
2633  NdArray<dtype> vec1 = inArray1({ theRow, theRow + 1 }, { 0, static_cast<int32>(arrayShape.cols) });
2634  NdArray<dtype> vec2 = inArray2({ theRow, theRow + 1 }, { 0, static_cast<int32>(arrayShape.cols) });
2635  NdArray<dtypeOut> vecCross = cross<dtypeOut>(vec1, vec2, Axis::NONE);
2636 
2637  returnArray.put({ theRow, theRow + 1 }, { 0, static_cast<int32>(returnArrayShape.cols) }, vecCross);
2638  }
2639 
2640  return std::move(returnArray);
2641  }
2642  default:
2643  {
2644  // this isn't actually possible, just putting this here to get rid
2645  // of the compiler warning.
2646  return std::move(NdArray<dtypeOut>(0));
2647  }
2648  }
2649  }

2789  //============================================================================
2790  // Method Description:
2799  template<typename dtype>
2800  NdArray<dtype> deleteIndices(const NdArray<dtype>& inArray, const NdArray<uint32>& inArrayIdxs, Axis inAxis)
2801  {
2802  // make sure that the indices are unique first
2803  NdArray<uint32> indices = unique(inArrayIdxs);
2804 
2805  switch (inAxis)
2806  {
2807  case Axis::NONE:
2808  {
2809  std::vector<dtype> values;
2810  for (uint32 i = 0; i < inArray.size(); ++i)
2811  {
2812  if (indices.contains(i).item())
2813  {
2814  continue;
2815  }
2816 
2817  values.push_back(inArray[i]);
2818  }
2819 
2820  return std::move(NdArray<dtype>(values));
2821  }
2822  case Axis::ROW:
2823  {
2824  Shape inShape = inArray.shape();
2825  if (indices.max().item() >= inShape.rows)
2826  {
2827  std::string errStr = "ERROR: deleteIndices: input index value is greater than the number of rows in the array.";
2828  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
2829  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
2830  }
2831 
2832  uint32 numNewRows = inShape.rows - indices.size();
2833  NdArray<dtype> returnArray(numNewRows, inShape.cols);
2834 
2835  uint32 rowCounter = 0;
2836  for (uint32 row = 0; row < inShape.rows; ++row)
2837  {
2838  if (indices.contains(row).item())
2839  {
2840  continue;
2841  }
2842 
2843  for (uint32 col = 0; col < inShape.cols; ++col)
2844  {
2845  returnArray(rowCounter, col) = inArray(row, col);
2846  }
2847  ++rowCounter;
2848  }
2849 
2850  return std::move(returnArray);
2851  }
2852  case Axis::COL:
2853  {
2854  Shape inShape = inArray.shape();
2855  if (indices.max().item() >= inShape.cols)
2856  {
2857  std::string errStr = "ERROR: deleteIndices: input index value is greater than the number of cols in the array.";
2858  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
2859  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
2860  }
2861 
2862  uint32 numNewCols = inShape.cols - indices.size();
2863  NdArray<dtype> returnArray(inShape.rows, numNewCols);
2864 
2865  for (uint32 row = 0; row < inShape.rows; ++row)
2866  {
2867  uint32 colCounter = 0;
2868  for (uint32 col = 0; col < inShape.cols; ++col)
2869  {
2870  if (indices.contains(col).item())
2871  {
2872  continue;
2873  }
2874 
2875  returnArray(row, colCounter++) = inArray(row, col);
2876  }
2877  }
2878 
2879  return std::move(returnArray);
2880 
2881 
2882  }
2883  default:
2884  {
2885  // this isn't actually possible, just putting this here to get rid
2886  // of the compiler warning.
2887  return std::move(NdArray<dtype>(0));
2888  }
2889  }
2890  }
2891 
2892  //============================================================================
2893  // Method Description:
2902  template<typename dtype>
2903  NdArray<dtype> deleteIndices(const NdArray<dtype>& inArray, const Slice& inIndicesSlice, Axis inAxis)
2904  {
2905  Slice sliceCopy(inIndicesSlice);
2906 
2907  switch (inAxis)
2908  {
2909  case Axis::NONE:
2910  {
2911  sliceCopy.makePositiveAndValidate(inArray.size());
2912  break;
2913  }
2914  case Axis::ROW:
2915  {
2916  sliceCopy.makePositiveAndValidate(inArray.shape().cols);
2917  break;
2918  }
2919  case Axis::COL:
2920  {
2921  sliceCopy.makePositiveAndValidate(inArray.shape().rows);
2922  break;
2923  }
2924  }
2925 
2926  std::vector<uint32> indices;
2927  for (uint32 i = static_cast<uint32>(sliceCopy.start); i < static_cast<uint32>(sliceCopy.stop); i += sliceCopy.step)
2928  {
2929  indices.push_back(i);
2930  }
2931 
2932  return std::move(deleteIndices(inArray, NdArray<uint32>(indices), inAxis));
2933  }
2934

2936  // Method Description:
2945  template<typename dtype>
2946  NdArray<dtype> deleteIndices(const NdArray<dtype>& inArray, uint32 inIndex, Axis inAxis)
2947  {
2948  NdArray<uint32> inIndices = { inIndex };
2949  return std::move(deleteIndices(inArray, inIndices, inAxis));
2950  }

2994  //============================================================================
2995  // Method Description:
3006  template<typename dtype>
3007  NdArray<dtype> diff(const NdArray<dtype>& inArray, Axis inAxis)
3008  {
3009  Shape inShape = inArray.shape();
3010 
3011  switch (inAxis)
3012  {
3013  case Axis::NONE:
3014  {
3015  if (inArray.size() < 2)
3016  {
3017  return std::move(NdArray<dtype>(0));
3018  }
3019 
3020  NdArray<dtype> returnArray(1, inArray.size() - 1);
3021  std::transform(inArray.cbegin(), inArray.cend() - 1, inArray.cbegin() + 1, returnArray.begin(),
3022  [](dtype inValue1, dtype inValue2) { return inValue2 - inValue1; });
3023 
3024  return std::move(returnArray);
3025  }
3026  case Axis::COL:
3027  {
3028  if (inShape.cols < 2)
3029  {
3030  return std::move(NdArray<dtype>(0));
3031  }
3032 
3033  NdArray<dtype> returnArray(inShape.rows, inShape.cols - 1);
3034  for (uint32 row = 0; row < inShape.rows; ++row)
3035  {
3036  std::transform(inArray.cbegin(row), inArray.cend(row) - 1, inArray.cbegin(row) + 1, returnArray.begin(row),
3037  [](dtype inValue1, dtype inValue2) { return inValue2 - inValue1; });
3038  }
3039 
3040  return std::move(returnArray);
3041  }
3042  case Axis::ROW:
3043  {
3044  if (inShape.rows < 2)
3045  {
3046  return std::move(NdArray<dtype>(0));
3047  }
3048 
3049  NdArray<dtype> transArray = inArray.transpose();
3050  Shape transShape = transArray.shape();
3051  NdArray<dtype> returnArray(transShape.rows, transShape.cols - 1);
3052  for (uint32 row = 0; row < transShape.rows; ++row)
3053  {
3054  std::transform(transArray.cbegin(row), transArray.cend(row) - 1, transArray.cbegin(row) + 1, returnArray.begin(row),
3055  [](dtype inValue1, dtype inValue2) { return inValue2 - inValue1; });
3056  }
3057 
3058  return std::move(returnArray.transpose());
3059  }
3060  default:
3061  {
3062  // this isn't actually possible, just putting this here to get rid
3063  // of the compiler warning.
3064  return std::move(NdArray<dtype>(0));
3065  }
3066  }
3067  }

3412  // Method Description:
3425  template<typename dtype>
3426  NdArray<dtype> eye(uint32 inN, uint32 inM, int32 inK)
3427  {
3428  NdArray<dtype> returnArray(inN, inM);
3429  returnArray.zeros();
3430 
3431  if (inK < 0)
3432  {
3433  uint32 col = 0;
3434  for (uint32 row = inK; row < inN; ++row)
3435  {
3436  if (col >= inM)
3437  {
3438  break;
3439  }
3440 
3441  returnArray(row, col++) = 1;
3442  }
3443  }
3444  else
3445  {
3446  uint32 row = 0;
3447  for (uint32 col = inK; col < inM; ++col)
3448  {
3449  if (row >= inN)
3450  {
3451  break;
3452  }
3453 
3454  returnArray(row++, col) = 1;
3455  }
3456  }
3457 
3458  return std::move(returnArray);
3459  }

3585  template<typename dtype>
3586  NdArray<dtype> flip(const NdArray<dtype>& inArray, Axis inAxis)
3587  {
3588  switch (inAxis)
3589  {
3590  case Axis::NONE:
3591  {
3592  NdArray<dtype> returnArray(inArray);
3593  std::reverse(returnArray.begin(), returnArray.end());
3594  return std::move(returnArray);
3595  }
3596  case Axis::COL:
3597  {
3598  NdArray<dtype> returnArray(inArray);
3599  for (uint32 row = 0; row < inArray.shape().rows; ++row)
3600  {
3601  std::reverse(returnArray.begin(row), returnArray.end(row));
3602  }
3603  return std::move(returnArray);
3604  }
3605  case Axis::ROW:
3606  {
3607  NdArray<dtype> returnArray = inArray.transpose();
3608  for (uint32 row = 0; row < returnArray.shape().rows; ++row)
3609  {
3610  std::reverse(returnArray.begin(row), returnArray.end(row));
3611  }
3612  return std::move(returnArray.transpose());
3613  }
3614  default:
3615  {
3616  return std::move(NdArray<dtype>(0));
3617  }
3618  }
3619  }

3904  // Method Description:
3916  template<typename dtype>
3917  NdArray<dtype> fromfile(const std::string& inFilename, const std::string& inSep)
3918  {
3919  boost::filesystem::path p(inFilename);
3920  if (!boost::filesystem::exists(inFilename))
3921  {
3922  std::string errStr = "ERROR: fromfile: input filename does not exist.\n\t" + inFilename;
3923  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
3924  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
3925  }
3926 
3927  if (inSep.compare("") == 0)
3928  {
3929  // read in as binary file
3930  std::ifstream in(inFilename.c_str(), std::ios::in | std::ios::binary);
3931  in.seekg(0, in.end);
3932  uint32 fileSize = static_cast<uint32>(in.tellg());
3933 
3934  FILE* filePtr = fopen(inFilename.c_str(), "rb");
3935  if (filePtr == NULL)
3936  {
3937  std::string errStr = "ERROR: fromfile: unable to open the file.";
3938  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
3939  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
3940  }
3941 
3942  char* fileBuffer = new char[fileSize];
3943  size_t bytesRead = fread(fileBuffer, sizeof(char), fileSize, filePtr);
3944  fclose(filePtr);
3945 
3946  NdArray<dtype> returnArray(reinterpret_cast<dtype*>(fileBuffer), static_cast<uint32>(bytesRead));
3947  delete[] fileBuffer;
3948 
3949  return std::move(returnArray);
3950  }
3951  else
3952  {
3953  // read in as txt file
3954  if (!(inSep.compare(" ") == 0 || inSep.compare("\t") == 0 || inSep.compare("\n") == 0))
3955  {
3956  std::string errStr = "ERROR: fromfile: only [' ', '\\t', '\\n'] seperators are supported";
3957  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
3958  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
3959  }
3960 
3961  std::vector<dtype> values;
3962 
3963  std::ifstream file(inFilename.c_str());
3964  if (file.is_open())
3965  {
3966  while (!file.eof())
3967  {
3968  std::string line;
3969  std::getline(file, line);
3970 
3971  std::istringstream iss(line);
3972  try
3973  {
3974  values.push_back(static_cast<dtype>(std::stod(iss.str())));
3975  }
3976  catch (const std::invalid_argument& ia)
3977  {
3978  std::cout << "Warning: fromfile: " << ia.what() << std::endl;
3980  }
3981  }
3982  file.close();
3983  }
3984  else
3985  {
3986  std::string errStr = "ERROR: fromfile: unable to open file.";
3987  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
3988  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
3989  }
3990 
3991  return std::move(NdArray<dtype>(values));
3992  }
3993  }

4137  //============================================================================
4138  // Method Description:
4149  template<typename dtype>
4150  NdArray<double> gradient(const NdArray<dtype>& inArray, Axis inAxis = Axis::ROW)
4151  {
4152  switch (inAxis)
4153  {
4154  case Axis::ROW:
4155  {
4156  auto inShape = inArray.shape();
4157  if (inShape.rows < 2)
4158  {
4159  std::string errStr = "ERROR: gradient: input array must have more than 1 row.";
4160  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
4161  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
4162  }
4163 
4164  // first do the first and last rows
4165  auto returnArray = NdArray<double>(inShape);
4166  for (uint32 col = 0; col < inShape.cols; ++col)
4167  {
4168  returnArray(0, col) = static_cast<double>(inArray(1, col)) - static_cast<double>(inArray(0, col));
4169  returnArray(-1, col) = static_cast<double>(inArray(-1, col)) - static_cast<double>(inArray(-2, col));
4170  }
4171 
4172  // then rip through the rest of the array
4173  for (uint32 col = 0; col < inShape.cols; ++col)
4174  {
4175  for (uint32 row = 1; row < inShape.rows - 1; ++row)
4176  {
4177  returnArray(row, col) = (static_cast<double>(inArray(row + 1, col)) - static_cast<double>(inArray(row - 1, col))) / 2.0;
4178  }
4179  }
4180 
4181  return std::move(returnArray);
4182  }
4183  case Axis::COL:
4184  {
4185  auto inShape = inArray.shape();
4186  if (inShape.cols < 2)
4187  {
4188  std::string errStr = "ERROR: gradient: input array must have more than 1 columns.";
4189  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
4190  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
4191  }
4192 
4193  // first do the first and last columns
4194  auto returnArray = NdArray<double>(inShape);
4195  for (uint32 row = 0; row < inShape.rows; ++row)
4196  {
4197  returnArray(row, 0) = static_cast<double>(inArray(row, 1)) - static_cast<double>(inArray(row, 0));
4198  returnArray(row, -1) = static_cast<double>(inArray(row, -1)) - static_cast<double>(inArray(row, -2));
4199  }
4200 
4201  // then rip through the rest of the array
4202  for (uint32 row = 0; row < inShape.rows; ++row)
4203  {
4204  for (uint32 col = 1; col < inShape.cols - 1; ++col)
4205  {
4206  returnArray(row, col) = (static_cast<double>(inArray(row, col + 1)) - static_cast<double>(inArray(row, col - 1))) / 2.0;
4207  }
4208  }
4209 
4210  return std::move(returnArray);
4211  }
4212  default:
4213  {
4214  // will return the gradient of the flattened array
4215  if (inArray.size() < 2)
4216  {
4217  std::string errStr = "ERROR: gradient: input array must have more than 1 element.";
4218  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
4219  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
4220  }
4221 
4222  auto returnArray = NdArray<double>(1, inArray.size());
4223  returnArray[0] = static_cast<double>(inArray[1]) - static_cast<double>(inArray[0]);
4224  returnArray[-1] = static_cast<double>(inArray[-1]) - static_cast<double>(inArray[-2]);
4225  for (uint32 i = 1; i < inArray.size() - 1; ++i)
4226  {
4227  returnArray[i] = (static_cast<double>(inArray[i + 1]) - static_cast<double>(inArray[i - 1])) / 2.0;
4228  }
4229 
4230  return std::move(returnArray);
4231  }
4232  }
4233  }

4271  //============================================================================
4272  // Method Description:
4284  template<typename dtype>
4285  std::pair<NdArray<uint32>, NdArray<double> > histogram(const NdArray<dtype>& inArray, uint32 inNumBins)
4286  {
4287  if (inNumBins == 0)
4288  {
4289  std::string errStr = "ERROR: histogram: number of bins must be positive.";
4290  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
4291  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
4292  }
4293 
4294  NdArray<uint32> histo = zeros<uint32>(1, inNumBins);
4295 
4296  bool useEndPoint = true;
4297  NdArray<double> binEdges = linspace(static_cast<double>(inArray.min().item()),
4298  static_cast<double>(inArray.max().item()), inNumBins + 1, useEndPoint);
4299 
4300  for (uint32 i = 0; i < inArray.size(); ++i)
4301  {
4302  // binary search to find the bin idx
4303  bool keepSearching = true;
4304  uint32 lowIdx = 0;
4305  uint32 highIdx = binEdges.size() - 1;
4306  while (keepSearching)
4307  {
4308  uint32 idx = (lowIdx + highIdx) / 2; // integer division
4309  if (lowIdx == highIdx || lowIdx == highIdx - 1)
4310  {
4311  // we found the bin
4312  ++histo[lowIdx];
4313  break;
4314  }
4315 
4316  if (inArray[i] > binEdges[idx])
4317  {
4318  lowIdx = idx;
4319  }
4320  else if (inArray[i] < binEdges[idx])
4321  {
4322  highIdx = idx;
4323  }
4324  else
4325  {
4326  // we found the bin
4327  ++histo[idx];
4328  break;
4329  }
4330  }
4331  }
4332 
4333  return std::move(std::make_pair(histo, binEdges));
4334  }

4451  //============================================================================
4452  // Method Description:
4469  template<typename dtype>
4470  NdArray<dtype> interp(const NdArray<dtype>& inX, const NdArray<dtype>& inXp, const NdArray<dtype>& inFp)
4471  {
4472  // do some error checking first
4473  if (inXp.size() != inFp.size())
4474  {
4475  std::string errStr = "ERROR: interp: inXp and inFp need to be the same size().";
4476  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
4477  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
4478  }
4479 
4480  if (inX.min().item() < inXp.min().item() || inX.max().item() > inXp.max().item())
4481  {
4482  std::string errStr = "ERROR: interp: endpoints of inX should be contained within inXp.";
4483  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
4484  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
4485  }
4486 
4487  // sort the input inXp and inFp data
4488  NdArray<uint32> sortedXpIdxs = argsort(inXp);
4489  NdArray<dtype> sortedXp(1, inFp.size());
4490  NdArray<dtype> sortedFp(1, inFp.size());
4491  for (uint32 i = 0; i < sortedXpIdxs.size(); ++i)
4492  {
4493  sortedXp[i] = inXp[sortedXpIdxs[i]];
4494  sortedFp[i] = inFp[sortedXpIdxs[i]];
4495  }
4496 
4497  // sort the input inX array
4498  NdArray<dtype> sortedX = sort(inX);
4499 
4500  NdArray<dtype> returnArray(1, inX.size());
4501 
4502  uint32 currXpIdx = 0;
4503  uint32 currXidx = 0;
4504  while (currXidx < sortedX.size())
4505  {
4506  if (sortedXp[currXpIdx] <= sortedX[currXidx] && sortedX[currXidx] <= sortedXp[currXpIdx + 1])
4507  {
4508  double percent = static_cast<double>(sortedX[currXidx] - sortedXp[currXpIdx]) /
4509  static_cast<double>(sortedXp[currXpIdx + 1] - sortedXp[currXpIdx]);
4510  returnArray[currXidx++] = Utils::interp(sortedFp[currXpIdx], sortedFp[currXpIdx + 1], percent);
4511  }
4512  else
4513  {
4514  ++currXpIdx;
4515  }
4516  }
4517 
4518  return std::move(returnArray);
4519  }
4520 
4521  //============================================================================
4522  // Method Description:
4535  template<typename dtype>
4536  NdArray<dtype> intersect1d(const NdArray<dtype>& inArray1, const NdArray<dtype>& inArray2)
4537  {
4538  std::vector<dtype> res(inArray1.size() + inArray2.size());
4539  std::set<dtype> in1(inArray1.cbegin(), inArray1.cend());
4540  std::set<dtype> in2(inArray2.cbegin(), inArray2.cend());
4541 
4542  typename std::vector<dtype>::iterator iter = std::set_intersection(in1.begin(), in1.end(),
4543  in2.begin(), in2.end(), res.begin());
4544  res.resize(iter - res.begin());
4545  return std::move(NdArray<dtype>(res));
4546  }

4586  {

4588  {
4589  std::string errStr = "ERROR: isclose: input array shapes are not consistant.";
4590  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;

4592  }

4596  [inRtol, inAtol](dtype inValueA, dtype inValueB) { return std::abs(inValueA - inValueB) <= (inAtol + inRtol * std::abs(inValueB)); });
4597 
4598  return std::move(returnArray);
4599  }

4832  //============================================================================
4833  // Method Description:
4854  template<typename dtype>
4855  NdArray<dtype> linspace(dtype inStart, dtype inStop, uint32 inNum, bool endPoint)
4856  {
4857  if (inNum == 0)
4858  {
4859  return std::move(NdArray<dtype>(0));
4860  }
4861  else if (inNum == 1)
4862  {
4863  NdArray<dtype> returnArray = { inStart };
4864  return std::move(returnArray);
4865  }
4866 
4867  if (inStop <= inStart)
4868  {
4869  std::string errStr = "ERROR: linspace: stop value must be greater than the start value.";
4870  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
4871  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
4872  }
4873 
4874  if (endPoint)
4875  {
4876  if (inNum == 2)
4877  {
4878  NdArray<dtype> returnArray = { inStart, inStop };
4879  return std::move(returnArray);
4880  }
4881  else
4882  {
4883  NdArray<dtype> returnArray(1, inNum);
4884  returnArray[0] = inStart;
4885  returnArray[inNum - 1] = inStop;
4886 
4887  dtype step = (inStop - inStart) / (inNum - 1);
4888  for (uint32 i = 1; i < inNum - 1; ++i)
4889  {
4890  returnArray[i] = returnArray[i - 1] + step;
4891  }
4892 
4893  return std::move(returnArray);
4894  }
4895  }
4896  else
4897  {
4898  if (inNum == 2)
4899  {
4900  dtype step = (inStop - inStart) / (inNum);
4901  NdArray<dtype> returnArray = { inStart, inStart + step };
4902  return std::move(returnArray);
4903  }
4904  else
4905  {
4906  NdArray<dtype> returnArray(1, inNum);
4907  returnArray[0] = inStart;
4908 
4909  dtype step = (inStop - inStart) / inNum;
4910  for (uint32 i = 1; i < inNum; ++i)
4911  {
4912  returnArray[i] = returnArray[i - 1] + step;
4913  }
4914 
4915  return std::move(returnArray);
4916  }
4917  }
4918  }

5523  //============================================================================
5524  // Method Description:
5535  template<typename dtype>
5536  NdArray<double> nanmean(const NdArray<dtype>& inArray, Axis inAxis)
5537  {
5538  switch (inAxis)
5539  {
5540  case Axis::NONE:
5541  {
5542  double sum = static_cast<double>(std::accumulate(inArray.cbegin(), inArray.cend(), 0.0,
5543  [](dtype inValue1, dtype inValue2) { return std::isnan(inValue2) ? inValue1 : inValue1 + inValue2; }));
5544 
5545  double numberNonNan = static_cast<double>(std::accumulate(inArray.cbegin(), inArray.cend(), 0.0,
5546  [](dtype inValue1, dtype inValue2) { return std::isnan(inValue2) ? inValue1 : inValue1 + 1; }));
5547 
5548  NdArray<double> returnArray = { sum /= numberNonNan };
5549 
5550  return std::move(returnArray);
5551  }
5552  case Axis::COL:
5553  {
5554  Shape inShape = inArray.shape();
5555  NdArray<double> returnArray(1, inShape.rows);
5556  for (uint32 row = 0; row < inShape.rows; ++row)
5557  {
5558  double sum = static_cast<double>(std::accumulate(inArray.cbegin(row), inArray.cend(row), 0.0,
5559  [](dtype inValue1, dtype inValue2) { return std::isnan(inValue2) ? inValue1 : inValue1 + inValue2; }));
5560 
5561  double numberNonNan = static_cast<double>(std::accumulate(inArray.cbegin(row), inArray.cend(row), 0.0,
5562  [](dtype inValue1, dtype inValue2) { return std::isnan(inValue2) ? inValue1 : inValue1 + 1; }));
5563 
5564  returnArray(0, row) = sum / numberNonNan;
5565  }
5566 
5567  return std::move(returnArray);
5568  }
5569  case Axis::ROW:
5570  {
5571  NdArray<dtype> transposedArray = inArray.transpose();
5572  Shape transShape = transposedArray.shape();
5573  NdArray<double> returnArray(1, transShape.rows);
5574  for (uint32 row = 0; row < transShape.rows; ++row)
5575  {
5576  double sum = static_cast<double>(std::accumulate(transposedArray.cbegin(row), transposedArray.cend(row), 0.0,
5577  [](dtype inValue1, dtype inValue2) { return std::isnan(inValue2) ? inValue1 : inValue1 + inValue2; }));
5578 
5579  double numberNonNan = static_cast<double>(std::accumulate(transposedArray.cbegin(row), transposedArray.cend(row), 0.0,
5580  [](dtype inValue1, dtype inValue2) { return std::isnan(inValue2) ? inValue1 : inValue1 + 1; }));
5581 
5582  returnArray(0, row) = sum / numberNonNan;
5583  }
5584 
5585  return std::move(returnArray);
5586  }
5587  default:
5588  {
5589  // this isn't actually possible, just putting this here to get rid
5590  // of the compiler warning.
5591  return std::move(NdArray<double>(0));
5592  }
5593  }
5594  }

5597  // Method Description:
5608  template<typename dtype>
5609  NdArray<dtype> nanmedian(const NdArray<dtype>& inArray, Axis inAxis)
5610  {
5611  switch (inAxis)
5612  {
5613  case Axis::NONE:
5614  {
5615  std::vector<dtype> values;
5616  for (uint32 i = 0; i < inArray.size(); ++i)
5617  {
5618  if (!std::isnan(inArray[i]))
5619  {
5620  values.push_back(inArray[i]);
5621  }
5622  }
5623 
5624  uint32 middle = static_cast<uint32>(values.size()) / 2;
5625  std::nth_element(values.begin(), values.begin() + middle, values.end());
5626  NdArray<dtype> returnArray = { values[middle] };
5627 
5628  return std::move(returnArray);
5629  }
5630  case Axis::COL:
5631  {
5632  Shape inShape = inArray.shape();
5633  NdArray<dtype> returnArray(1, inShape.rows);
5634  for (uint32 row = 0; row < inShape.rows; ++row)
5635  {
5636  std::vector<dtype> values;
5637  for (uint32 col = 0; col < inShape.cols; ++col)
5638  {
5639  if (!std::isnan(inArray(row, col)))
5640  {
5641  values.push_back(inArray(row, col));
5642  }
5643  }
5644 
5645  uint32 middle = static_cast<uint32>(values.size()) / 2;
5646  std::nth_element(values.begin(), values.begin() + middle, values.end());
5647  returnArray(0, row) = values[middle];
5648  }
5649 
5650  return std::move(returnArray);
5651  }
5652  case Axis::ROW:
5653  {
5654  NdArray<dtype> transposedArray = inArray.transpose();
5655  Shape inShape = transposedArray.shape();
5656  NdArray<dtype> returnArray(1, inShape.rows);
5657  for (uint32 row = 0; row < inShape.rows; ++row)
5658  {
5659  std::vector<dtype> values;
5660  for (uint32 col = 0; col < inShape.cols; ++col)
5661  {
5662  if (!std::isnan(transposedArray(row, col)))
5663  {
5664  values.push_back(transposedArray(row, col));
5665  }
5666  }
5667 
5668  uint32 middle = static_cast<uint32>(values.size()) / 2;
5669  std::nth_element(values.begin(), values.begin() + middle, values.end());
5670  returnArray(0, row) = values[middle];
5671  }
5672 
5673  return std::move(returnArray);
5674  }
5675  default:
5676  {
5677  // this isn't actually possible, just putting this here to get rid
5678  // of the compiler warning.
5679  return std::move(NdArray<dtype>(0));
5680  }
5681  }
5682  }

5685  // Method Description:
5696  template<typename dtype>
5697  NdArray<dtype> nanmin(const NdArray<dtype>& inArray, Axis inAxis)
5698  {
5699  NdArray<dtype> arrayCopy(inArray);
5700  for (uint32 i = 0; i < arrayCopy.size(); ++i)
5701  {
5702  if (std::isnan(arrayCopy[i]))
5703  {
5704  arrayCopy[i] = DtypeInfo<dtype>::max();
5705  }
5706  }
5707 
5708  return std::move(min(arrayCopy, inAxis));

5711  //============================================================================
5712  // Method Description:
5724  template<typename dtypeOut = double, typename dtype>
5725  NdArray<double> nanpercentile(const NdArray<dtype>& inArray, double inPercentile, Axis inAxis, const std::string& inInterpMethod)
5726  {
5727  if (inPercentile < 0 || inPercentile > 100)
5728  {
5729  std::string errStr = "ERROR: percentile: input percentile value must be of the range [0, 100].";
5730  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
5731  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
5732  }
5733 
5734  if (inInterpMethod.compare("linear") != 0 &&
5735  inInterpMethod.compare("lower") != 0 &&
5736  inInterpMethod.compare("higher") != 0 &&
5737  inInterpMethod.compare("nearest") != 0 &&
5738  inInterpMethod.compare("midpoint") != 0)
5739  {
5740  std::string errStr = "ERROR: percentile: input interpolation method is not a vaid option.\n";
5741  errStr += "\tValid options are 'linear', 'lower', 'higher', 'nearest', 'midpoint'.";
5742  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
5743  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
5744  }
5745 
5746  switch (inAxis)
5747  {
5748  case Axis::NONE:
5749  {
5750  if (inPercentile == 0)
5751  {
5752  for (uint32 i = 0; i < inArray.size(); ++i)
5753  {
5754  if (!isnan(inArray[i]))
5755  {
5756  NdArray<dtypeOut> returnArray = { static_cast<dtypeOut>(inArray[i]) };
5757  return std::move(returnArray);
5758  }
5759  }
5760  return std::move(NdArray<dtypeOut>(0));
5761  }
5762  else if (inPercentile == 1)
5763  {
5764  for (int32 i = static_cast<int32>(inArray.size()) - 1; i > -1; --i)
5765  {
5766  if (!isnan(inArray[i]))
5767  {
5768  NdArray<dtypeOut> returnArray = { static_cast<dtypeOut>(inArray[i]) };
5769  return std::move(returnArray);
5770  }
5771  }
5772  return std::move(NdArray<dtypeOut>(0));
5773  }
5774 
5775  std::vector<double> arrayCopy;
5776  uint32 numNonNan = 0;
5777  for (uint32 j = 0; j < inArray.size(); ++j)
5778  {
5779  if (!isnan(inArray[j]))
5780  {
5781  arrayCopy.push_back(inArray[j]);
5782  ++numNonNan;
5783  }
5784  }
5785 
5786  if (arrayCopy.size() < 2)
5787  {
5788  return std::move(NdArray<dtypeOut>(0));
5789  }
5790 
5791  int32 i = static_cast<int32>(std::floor(static_cast<double>(numNonNan - 1) * inPercentile / 100.0));
5792  uint32 indexLower = static_cast<uint32>(clip<uint32>(i, 0, numNonNan - 2));
5793 
5794  std::sort(arrayCopy.begin(), arrayCopy.end());
5795 
5796  if (inInterpMethod.compare("linear") == 0)
5797  {
5798  double percentI = static_cast<double>(indexLower) / static_cast<double>(numNonNan - 1);
5799  double fraction = (inPercentile / 100.0 - percentI) /
5800  (static_cast<double>(indexLower + 1) / static_cast<double>(numNonNan - 1) - percentI);
5801 
5802  double returnValue = arrayCopy[indexLower] + (arrayCopy[indexLower + 1] - arrayCopy[indexLower]) * fraction;
5803  NdArray<dtypeOut> returnArray = { static_cast<dtypeOut>(returnValue) };
5804  return std::move(returnArray);
5805  }
5806  else if (inInterpMethod.compare("lower") == 0)
5807  {
5808  NdArray<dtypeOut> returnArray = { static_cast<dtypeOut>(arrayCopy[indexLower]) };
5809  return std::move(returnArray);
5810  }
5811  else if (inInterpMethod.compare("higher") == 0)
5812  {
5813  NdArray<dtypeOut> returnArray = { static_cast<dtypeOut>(arrayCopy[indexLower + 1]) };
5814  return std::move(returnArray);
5815  }
5816  else if (inInterpMethod.compare("nearest") == 0)
5817  {
5818  double percent = inPercentile / 100.0;
5819  double percent1 = static_cast<double>(indexLower) / static_cast<double>(numNonNan - 1);
5820  double percent2 = static_cast<double>(indexLower + 1) / static_cast<double>(numNonNan - 1);
5821  double diff1 = percent - percent1;
5822  double diff2 = percent2 - percent;
5823 
5824  switch (argmin<double>({ diff1, diff2 }).item())
5825  {
5826  case 0:
5827  {
5828  NdArray<dtypeOut> returnArray = { static_cast<dtypeOut>(arrayCopy[indexLower]) };
5829  return std::move(returnArray);
5830  }
5831  case 1:
5832  {
5833  NdArray<dtypeOut> returnArray = { static_cast<dtypeOut>(arrayCopy[indexLower + 1]) };
5834  return std::move(returnArray);
5835  }
5836  }
5837  }
5838  else if (inInterpMethod.compare("midpoint") == 0)
5839  {
5840  NdArray<dtypeOut> returnArray = { (arrayCopy[indexLower] + arrayCopy[indexLower + 1]) / 2.0 };
5841  return std::move(returnArray);
5842  }
5843  }
5844  case Axis::COL:
5845  {
5846  Shape inShape = inArray.shape();
5847 
5848  NdArray<dtypeOut> returnArray(1, inShape.rows);
5849  for (uint32 row = 0; row < inShape.rows; ++row)
5850  {
5851  NdArray<dtypeOut> outValue = nanpercentile<dtypeOut>(NdArray<dtype>(inArray.cbegin(row), inArray.cend(row)),
5852  inPercentile, Axis::NONE, inInterpMethod);
5853 
5854  if (outValue.size() == 1)
5855  {
5856  returnArray[row] = outValue.item();
5857  }
5858  else
5859  {
5860  returnArray[row] = Constants::nan;
5861  }
5862  }
5863 
5864  return std::move(returnArray);
5865  }
5866  case Axis::ROW:
5867  {
5868  NdArray<dtype> arrayTrans = inArray.transpose();
5869  Shape inShape = arrayTrans.shape();
5870 
5871  NdArray<dtypeOut> returnArray(1, inShape.rows);
5872  for (uint32 row = 0; row < inShape.rows; ++row)
5873  {
5874  NdArray<dtypeOut> outValue = nanpercentile<dtypeOut>(NdArray<dtype>(arrayTrans.cbegin(row), arrayTrans.cend(row)),
5875  inPercentile, Axis::NONE, inInterpMethod);
5876 
5877  if (outValue.size() == 1)
5878  {
5879  returnArray[row] = outValue.item();
5880  }
5881  else
5882  {
5883  returnArray[row] = Constants::nan;
5884  }
5885  }
5886 
5887  return std::move(returnArray);
5888  }
5889  default:
5890  {
5891  // this isn't actually possible, just putting this here to get rid
5892  // of the compiler warning.
5893  return std::move(NdArray<dtypeOut>(0));
5894  }
5895  }
5896  }

5911  NdArray<dtypeOut> nanprod(const NdArray<dtype>& inArray, Axis inAxis)

5918  arrayCopy[i] = 1;
5919  }
5920  }
5921 
5922  return std::move(prod<dtypeOut>(arrayCopy, inAxis));

5991  // Method Description:
6002  template<typename dtype>
6003  NdArray<double> nanstd(const NdArray<dtype>& inArray, Axis inAxis)
6004  {
6005  switch (inAxis)
6006  {
6007  case Axis::NONE:
6008  {
6009  double meanValue = nanmean(inArray, inAxis).item();
6010  double sum = 0;
6011  double counter = 0;
6012  for (uint32 i = 0; i < inArray.size(); ++i)
6013  {
6014  if (std::isnan(inArray[i]))
6015  {
6016  continue;
6017  }
6018 
6019  sum += Utils::sqr(static_cast<double>(inArray[i]) - meanValue);
6020  ++counter;
6021  }
6022  NdArray<double> returnArray = { std::sqrt(sum / counter) };
6023  return std::move(returnArray);
6024  }
6025  case Axis::COL:
6026  {
6027  Shape inShape = inArray.shape();
6028  NdArray<double> meanValue = nanmean(inArray, inAxis);
6029  NdArray<double> returnArray(1, inShape.rows);
6030  for (uint32 row = 0; row < inShape.rows; ++row)
6031  {
6032  double sum = 0;
6033  double counter = 0;
6034  for (uint32 col = 0; col < inShape.cols; ++col)
6035  {
6036  if (std::isnan(inArray(row, col)))
6037  {
6038  continue;
6039  }
6040 
6041  sum += Utils::sqr(static_cast<double>(inArray(row, col)) - meanValue[row]);
6042  ++counter;
6043  }
6044  returnArray(0, row) = std::sqrt(sum / counter);
6045  }
6046 
6047  return std::move(returnArray);
6048  }
6049  case Axis::ROW:
6050  {
6051  NdArray<double> meanValue = nanmean(inArray, inAxis);
6052  NdArray<dtype> transposedArray = inArray.transpose();
6053  Shape inShape = transposedArray.shape();
6054  NdArray<double> returnArray(1, inShape.rows);
6055  for (uint32 row = 0; row < inShape.rows; ++row)
6056  {
6057  double sum = 0;
6058  double counter = 0;
6059  for (uint32 col = 0; col < inShape.cols; ++col)
6060  {
6061  if (std::isnan(transposedArray(row, col)))
6062  {
6063  continue;
6064  }
6065 
6066  sum += Utils::sqr(static_cast<double>(transposedArray(row, col)) - meanValue[row]);
6067  ++counter;
6068  }
6069  returnArray(0, row) = std::sqrt(sum / counter);
6070  }
6071 
6072  return std::move(returnArray);
6073  }
6074  default:
6075  {
6076  // this isn't actually possible, just putting this here to get rid
6077  // of the compiler warning.
6078  return std::move(NdArray<double>(0));
6079  }
6080  }
6081  }

6384  // Method Description:
6401  template<typename dtypeOut = double, typename dtype>
6402  NdArray<dtypeOut> percentile(const NdArray<dtype>& inArray, double inPercentile, Axis inAxis, const std::string& inInterpMethod)
6403  {
6404  if (inPercentile < 0 || inPercentile > 100)
6405  {
6406  std::string errStr = "ERROR: percentile: input percentile value must be of the range [0, 100].";
6407  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
6408  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
6409  }
6410 
6411  if (inInterpMethod.compare("linear") != 0 &&
6412  inInterpMethod.compare("lower") != 0 &&
6413  inInterpMethod.compare("higher") != 0 &&
6414  inInterpMethod.compare("nearest") != 0 &&
6415  inInterpMethod.compare("midpoint") != 0)
6416  {
6417  std::string errStr = "ERROR: percentile: input interpolation method is not a vaid option.\n";
6418  errStr += "\tValid options are 'linear', 'lower', 'higher', 'nearest', 'midpoint'.";
6419  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
6420  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);

6425  case Axis::NONE:
6426  {
6427  if (inPercentile == 0)
6428  {

6430  return std::move(returnArray);
6431  }

6435  return std::move(returnArray);
6436  }
6437 
6438  int32 i = static_cast<int32>(std::floor(static_cast<double>(inArray.size() - 1) * inPercentile / 100.0));
6439  uint32 indexLower = static_cast<uint32>(clip<uint32>(i, 0, inArray.size() - 2));
6440 
6441  NdArray<double> arrayCopy = inArray.template astype<double>();
6442  std::sort(arrayCopy.begin(), arrayCopy.end());
6443 
6444  if (inInterpMethod.compare("linear") == 0)
6445  {
6446  double percentI = static_cast<double>(indexLower) / static_cast<double>(inArray.size() - 1);
6447  double fraction = (inPercentile / 100.0 - percentI) /
6448  (static_cast<double>(indexLower + 1) / static_cast<double>(inArray.size() - 1) - percentI);
6449 
6450  double returnValue = arrayCopy[indexLower] + (arrayCopy[indexLower + 1] - arrayCopy[indexLower]) * fraction;
6451  NdArray<dtypeOut> returnArray = { static_cast<dtypeOut>(returnValue) };
6452  return std::move(returnArray);
6453  }
6454  else if (inInterpMethod.compare("lower") == 0)
6455  {
6456  NdArray<dtypeOut> returnArray = { static_cast<dtypeOut>(arrayCopy[indexLower]) };
6457  return std::move(returnArray);
6458  }
6459  else if (inInterpMethod.compare("higher") == 0)
6460  {
6461  NdArray<dtypeOut> returnArray = { static_cast<dtypeOut>(arrayCopy[indexLower + 1]) };
6462  return std::move(returnArray);
6463  }
6464  else if (inInterpMethod.compare("nearest") == 0)
6465  {
6466  double percent = inPercentile / 100.0;
6467  double percent1 = static_cast<double>(indexLower) / static_cast<double>(inArray.size() - 1);
6468  double percent2 = static_cast<double>(indexLower + 1) / static_cast<double>(inArray.size() - 1);
6469  double diff1 = percent - percent1;
6470  double diff2 = percent2 - percent;
6471 
6472  switch (argmin<double>({ diff1, diff2 }).item())
6473  {
6474  case 0:
6475  {
6476  NdArray<dtypeOut> returnArray = { static_cast<dtypeOut>(arrayCopy[indexLower]) };
6477  return std::move(returnArray);
6478  }
6479  case 1:
6480  {
6481  NdArray<dtypeOut> returnArray = { static_cast<dtypeOut>(arrayCopy[indexLower + 1]) };
6482  return std::move(returnArray);
6483  }
6484  }
6485  }
6486  else if (inInterpMethod.compare("midpoint") == 0)
6487  {
6488  NdArray<dtypeOut> returnArray = { static_cast<dtypeOut>((arrayCopy[indexLower] + arrayCopy[indexLower + 1]) / 2.0) };
6489  return std::move(returnArray);
6490  }
6491  }
6492  case Axis::COL:
6493  {
6494  Shape inShape = inArray.shape();
6495 
6496  NdArray<dtypeOut> returnArray(1, inShape.rows);
6497  for (uint32 row = 0; row < inShape.rows; ++row)
6498  {
6499  returnArray[row] = percentile<dtypeOut>(NdArray<dtype>(inArray.cbegin(row), inArray.cend(row)),
6500  inPercentile, Axis::NONE, inInterpMethod).item();
6501  }
6502 
6503  return std::move(returnArray);
6504  }
6505  case Axis::ROW:
6506  {
6507  NdArray<dtype> arrayTrans = inArray.transpose();
6508  Shape inShape = arrayTrans.shape();
6509 
6510  NdArray<dtypeOut> returnArray(1, inShape.rows);
6511  for (uint32 row = 0; row < inShape.rows; ++row)
6512  {
6513  returnArray[row] = percentile<dtypeOut>(NdArray<dtype>(arrayTrans.cbegin(row), arrayTrans.cend(row)),
6514  inPercentile, Axis::NONE, inInterpMethod).item();
6515  }
6516 
6517  return std::move(returnArray);
6518  }
6519  default:
6520  {
6521  // this isn't actually possible, just putting this here to get rid
6522  // of the compiler warning.
6523  return std::move(NdArray<dtypeOut>(0));
6524  }
6525  }
6526  }
6527

7074  //============================================================================
7075  // Method Description:
7087  template<typename dtype>
7088  NdArray<dtype> roll(const NdArray<dtype>& inArray, int32 inShift, Axis inAxis)
7089  {
7090  switch (inAxis)
7091  {
7092  case Axis::NONE:
7093  {
7094  uint32 shift = std::abs(inShift) % inArray.size();
7095  if (inShift > 0)
7096  {
7097  shift = inArray.size() - shift;
7098  }
7099 
7100  NdArray<dtype> returnArray(inArray);
7101  std::rotate(returnArray.begin(), returnArray.begin() + shift, returnArray.end());
7102 
7103  return std::move(returnArray);
7104  }
7105  case Axis::COL:
7106  {
7107  Shape inShape = inArray.shape();
7108 
7109  uint32 shift = std::abs(inShift) % inShape.cols;
7110  if (inShift > 0)
7111  {
7112  shift = inShape.cols - shift;
7113  }
7114 
7115  NdArray<dtype> returnArray(inArray);
7116  for (uint32 row = 0; row < inShape.rows; ++row)
7117  {
7118  std::rotate(returnArray.begin(row), returnArray.begin(row) + shift, returnArray.end(row));
7119  }
7120 
7121  return std::move(returnArray);
7122  }
7123  case Axis::ROW:
7124  {
7125  Shape inShape = inArray.shape();
7126 
7127  uint32 shift = std::abs(inShift) % inShape.rows;
7128  if (inShift > 0)
7129  {
7130  shift = inShape.rows - shift;
7131  }
7132 
7133  NdArray<dtype> returnArray = inArray.transpose();
7134  for (uint32 row = 0; row < inShape.cols; ++row)
7135  {
7136  std::rotate(returnArray.begin(row), returnArray.begin(row) + shift, returnArray.end(row));
7137  }
7138 
7139  return std::move(returnArray.transpose());
7140  }
7141  default:
7142  {
7143  // this isn't actually possible, just putting this here to get rid
7144  // of the compiler warning.
7145  return std::move(NdArray<dtype>(0));
7146  }
7147  }
7148  }
7149 
7150  //============================================================================
7151  // Method Description:
7162  template<typename dtype>
7163  NdArray<dtype> rot90(const NdArray<dtype>& inArray, uint8 inK)
7164  {
7165  inK %= 4;
7166  switch (inK)
7167  {
7168  case 1:
7169  {
7170  return std::move(flipud(inArray.transpose()));
7171  }
7172  case 2:
7173  {
7174  return std::move(flip(inArray, Axis::NONE));
7175  }
7176  case 3:
7177  {
7178  return std::move(fliplr(inArray.transpose()));
7179  }
7180  default:
7181  {
7182  // this isn't actually possible, just putting this here to get rid
7183  // of the compiler warning.
7184  return std::move(NdArray<dtype>(0));
7185  }
7186  }
7187  }

7222  //============================================================================
7223  // Method Description:
7232  template<typename dtype>
7233  NdArray<dtype> row_stack(const std::initializer_list<NdArray<dtype> >& inArrayList)
7234  {
7235  // first loop through to calculate the final size of the array
7236  typename std::initializer_list<NdArray<dtype> >::iterator iter;
7237  Shape finalShape;
7238  for (iter = inArrayList.begin(); iter < inArrayList.end(); ++iter)
7239  {
7240  if (finalShape.isnull())
7241  {
7242  finalShape = iter->shape();
7243  }
7244  else if (iter->shape().cols != finalShape.cols)
7245  {
7246  std::string errStr = "ERROR: row_stack: input arrays must have the same number of columns.";
7247  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
7248  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
7249  }
7250  else
7251  {
7252  finalShape.rows += iter->shape().rows;
7253  }
7254  }
7255 
7256  // now that we know the final size, contruct the output array
7257  NdArray<dtype> returnArray(finalShape);
7258  uint32 rowStart = 0;
7259  for (iter = inArrayList.begin(); iter < inArrayList.end(); ++iter)
7260  {
7261  Shape theShape = iter->shape();
7262  for (uint32 row = 0; row < theShape.rows; ++row)
7263  {
7264  for (uint32 col = 0; col < theShape.cols; ++col)
7265  {
7266  returnArray(rowStart + row, col) = iter->operator()(row, col);
7267  }
7268  }
7269  rowStart += theShape.rows;
7270  }
7271 
7272  return std::move(returnArray);
7273  }

7275  //============================================================================
7276  // Method Description:
7288  template<typename dtype>
7289  NdArray<dtype> setdiff1d(const NdArray<dtype>& inArray1, const NdArray<dtype>& inArray2)
7290  {
7291  std::vector<dtype> res(inArray1.size() + inArray2.size());
7292  std::set<dtype> in1(inArray1.cbegin(), inArray1.cend());
7293  std::set<dtype> in2(inArray2.cbegin(), inArray2.cend());
7294 
7295  typename std::vector<dtype>::iterator iter = std::set_difference(in1.begin(), in1.end(),
7296  in2.begin(), in2.end(), res.begin());
7297  res.resize(iter - res.begin());
7298  return std::move(NdArray<dtype>(res));
7299  }

7893  //============================================================================
7894  // Method Description:
7906  template<typename dtype>
7907  NdArray<double> trapz(const NdArray<dtype>& inArray, double dx, Axis inAxis)
7908  {
7909  Shape inShape = inArray.shape();
7910  switch (inAxis)
7911  {
7912  case Axis::COL:
7913  {
7914  NdArray<double> returnArray(inShape.rows, 1);
7915  for (uint32 row = 0; row < inShape.rows; ++row)
7916  {
7917  double sum = 0;
7918  for (uint32 col = 0; col < inShape.cols - 1; ++col)
7919  {
7920  sum += static_cast<double>(inArray(row, col + 1) - inArray(row, col)) / 2.0 + static_cast<double>(inArray(row, col));
7921  }
7922 
7923  returnArray[row] = sum * dx;
7924  }
7925 
7926  return std::move(returnArray);
7927  }
7928  case Axis::ROW:
7929  {
7930  NdArray<dtype> arrayTranspose = inArray.transpose();
7931  Shape transShape = arrayTranspose.shape();
7932  NdArray<double> returnArray(transShape.rows, 1);
7933  for (uint32 row = 0; row < transShape.rows; ++row)
7934  {
7935  double sum = 0;
7936  for (uint32 col = 0; col < transShape.cols - 1; ++col)
7937  {
7938  sum += static_cast<double>(arrayTranspose(row, col + 1) - arrayTranspose(row, col)) / 2.0 + static_cast<double>(arrayTranspose(row, col));
7939  }
7940 
7941  returnArray[row] = sum * dx;
7942  }
7943 
7944  return std::move(returnArray);
7945  }
7946  case Axis::NONE:
7947  {
7948  double sum = 0.0;
7949  for (uint32 i = 0; i < inArray.size() - 1; ++i)
7950  {
7951  sum += static_cast<double>(inArray[i + 1] - inArray[i]) / 2.0 + static_cast<double>(inArray[i]);
7952  }
7953 
7954  NdArray<double> returnArray = { sum * dx };
7955  return std::move(returnArray);
7956  }
7957  default:
7958  {
7959  // this isn't actually possible, just putting this here to get rid
7960  // of the compiler warning.
7961  return std::move(NdArray<double>(0));
7962  }
7963  }
7964  }

7966  //============================================================================
7967  // Method Description:
7979  template<typename dtype>
7980  NdArray<double> trapz(const NdArray<dtype>& inArrayY, const NdArray<dtype>& inArrayX, Axis inAxis)
7981  {
7982  Shape inShapeY = inArrayY.shape();
7983  Shape inShapeX = inArrayX.shape();
7984 
7985  if (inShapeY != inShapeX)
7986  {
7987  std::string errStr = "ERROR: trapz: input x and y arrays should be the same shape.";
7988  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
7989  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
7990  }
7991 
7992  switch (inAxis)
7993  {
7994  case Axis::COL:
7995  {
7996  NdArray<double> returnArray(inShapeY.rows, 1);
7997  for (uint32 row = 0; row < inShapeY.rows; ++row)
7998  {
7999  double sum = 0;
8000  for (uint32 col = 0; col < inShapeY.cols - 1; ++col)
8001  {
8002  double dx = static_cast<double>(inArrayX(row, col + 1) - inArrayX(row, col));
8003  sum += dx * (static_cast<double>(inArrayY(row, col + 1) - inArrayY(row, col)) / 2.0 + static_cast<double>(inArrayY(row, col)));
8004  }
8005 
8006  returnArray[row] = sum;
8007  }
8008 
8009  return std::move(returnArray);
8010  }
8011  case Axis::ROW:
8012  {
8013  NdArray<dtype> arrayYTranspose = inArrayY.transpose();
8014  NdArray<dtype> arrayXTranspose = inArrayX.transpose();
8015  Shape transShape = arrayYTranspose.shape();
8016  NdArray<double> returnArray(transShape.rows, 1);
8017  for (uint32 row = 0; row < transShape.rows; ++row)
8018  {
8019  double sum = 0;
8020  for (uint32 col = 0; col < transShape.cols - 1; ++col)
8021  {
8022  double dx = static_cast<double>(arrayXTranspose(row, col + 1) - arrayXTranspose(row, col));
8023  sum += dx * (static_cast<double>(arrayYTranspose(row, col + 1) - arrayYTranspose(row, col)) / 2.0 + static_cast<double>(arrayYTranspose(row, col)));
8024  }
8025 
8026  returnArray[row] = sum;
8027  }
8028 
8029  return std::move(returnArray);
8030  }
8031  case Axis::NONE:
8032  {
8033  double sum = 0.0;
8034  for (uint32 i = 0; i < inArrayY.size() - 1; ++i)
8035  {
8036  double dx = static_cast<double>(inArrayX[i + 1] - inArrayX[i]);
8037  sum += dx * (static_cast<double>(inArrayY[i + 1] - inArrayY[i]) / 2.0 + static_cast<double>(inArrayY[i]));
8038  }
8039 
8040  NdArray<double> returnArray = { sum };
8041  return std::move(returnArray);
8042  }
8043  default:
8044  {
8045  // this isn't actually possible, just putting this here to get rid
8046  // of the compiler warning.
8047  return std::move(NdArray<double>(0));
8048  }
8049  }
8050  }

8053  // Method Description:
8065  template<typename dtype>
8066  NdArray<dtype> tril(uint32 inN, int32 inOffset)
8067  {
8068  uint32 rowStart = 0;
8069  uint32 colStart = 0;
8070  if (inOffset > 0)
8071  {
8072  colStart = inOffset;
8073  }
8074  else
8075  {
8076  rowStart = inOffset * -1;
8077  }
8078 
8079  NdArray<dtype> returnArray(inN);
8080  returnArray.zeros();
8081  for (uint32 row = rowStart; row < inN; ++row)
8082  {
8083  for (uint32 col = 0; col < row + colStart + 1 - rowStart; ++col)
8084  {
8085  if (col == inN)
8086  {
8087  break;
8088  }
8089 
8090  returnArray(row, col) = static_cast<dtype>(1);
8091  }
8092  }
8093 
8094  return std::move(returnArray);
8095  }

8263  //============================================================================
8264  // Method Description:
8275  template<typename dtype>
8276  NdArray<dtype> trim_zeros(const NdArray<dtype>& inArray, const std::string inTrim)
8277  {
8278  if (inTrim == "f")
8279  {
8280  uint32 place = 0;
8281  for (uint32 i = 0; i < inArray.size(); ++i)
8282  {
8283  if (inArray[i] != static_cast<dtype>(0))
8284  {
8285  break;
8286  }
8287  else
8288  {
8289  ++place;
8290  }
8291  }
8292 
8293  if (place == inArray.size())
8294  {
8295  return std::move(NdArray<dtype>(0));
8296  }
8297 
8298  NdArray<dtype> returnArray(1, inArray.size() - place);
8299  std::copy(inArray.cbegin() + place, inArray.cend(), returnArray.begin());
8300 
8301  return std::move(returnArray);
8302  }
8303  else if (inTrim == "b")
8304  {
8305  uint32 place = inArray.size();
8306  for (uint32 i = inArray.size() - 1; i > 0; --i)
8307  {
8308  if (inArray[i] != static_cast<dtype>(0))
8309  {
8310  break;
8311  }
8312  else
8313  {
8314  --place;
8315  }
8316  }
8317 
8318  if (place == 0 || (place == 1 && inArray[0] == 0))
8319  {
8320  return std::move(NdArray<dtype>(0));
8321  }
8322 
8323  NdArray<dtype> returnArray(1, place);
8324  std::copy(inArray.cbegin(), inArray.cbegin() + place, returnArray.begin());
8325 
8326  return std::move(returnArray);
8327  }
8328  else if (inTrim == "fb")
8329  {
8330  uint32 placeBegin = 0;
8331  for (uint32 i = 0; i < inArray.size(); ++i)
8332  {
8333  if (inArray[i] != static_cast<dtype>(0))
8334  {
8335  break;
8336  }
8337  else
8338  {
8339  ++placeBegin;
8340  }
8341  }
8342 
8343  if (placeBegin == inArray.size())
8344  {
8345  return std::move(NdArray<dtype>(0));
8346  }
8347 
8348  uint32 placeEnd = inArray.size();
8349  for (uint32 i = inArray.size() - 1; i > 0; --i)
8350  {
8351  if (inArray[i] != static_cast<dtype>(0))
8352  {
8353  break;
8354  }
8355  else
8356  {
8357  --placeEnd;
8358  }
8359  }
8360 
8361  if (placeEnd == 0 || (placeEnd == 1 && inArray[0] == 0))
8362  {
8363  return std::move(NdArray<dtype>(0));
8364  }
8365 
8366  NdArray<dtype> returnArray(1, placeEnd - placeBegin);
8367  std::copy(inArray.cbegin() + placeBegin, inArray.cbegin() + placeEnd, returnArray.begin());
8368 
8369  return std::move(returnArray);
8370  }
8371  else
8372  {
8373  std::string errStr = "ERROR: trim_zeros: trim options are 'f' = front, 'b' = back, 'fb' = front and back.";
8374  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
8375  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
8376  }
8377  }

8481  template<typename dtype>
8482  dtype unwrap(dtype inValue)
8483  {
8484  if (inValue < 0)
8485  {
8486  return inValue + 2 * Constants::pi;
8487  }
8488  else if (inValue >= 2 * Constants::pi)
8489  {
8490  return inValue - 2 * Constants::pi;
8491  }
8492  else
8493  {
8494  return inValue;
8495  }
8496  }

8557  // Method Description:
8569  template<typename dtype>
8570  NdArray<dtype> where(const NdArray<bool>& inMask, const NdArray<dtype>& inA, const NdArray<dtype>& inB)
8571  {
8572  auto shapeMask = inMask.shape();
8573  auto shapeA = inA.shape();
8574  if (shapeA != inB.shape())
8575  {
8576  std::string errStr = "ERROR: where: input inA and inB must be the same shapes.";
8577  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
8578  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
8579  }
8580 
8581  if (shapeMask != shapeA)
8582  {
8583  std::string errStr = "ERROR: where: input inMask must be the same shape as the input arrays.";
8584  std::cerr << errStr << std::endl;
8585  throw std::invalid_argument(errStr);
8586  }
8587 
8588  auto outArray = NdArray<dtype>(shapeMask);
8589 
8590  for (uint32 i = 0; i < shapeMask.size(); ++i)
8591  {
8592  if (inMask[i])
8593  {
8594  outArray[i] = inA[i];
8595  }
8596  else
8597  {
8598  outArray[i] = inB[i];
8599  }
8600  }
8601 
8602  return std::move(outArray);
8603  }
